snippet.title: Tigers in the Snow  - 1981  - Apple II
snippet.description:
SSI's early 1980s winning streak was continued with this game.
The gameplay is very enjoyable, and the speed of the computer turns are good enough to play this even today. The graphics are pleasing for 1981: there is no scrolling, but the map is detailed, and the units are simple but purposful. I specifically like that there are lots of units in the game, and this makes the map busy, yet it is not boring to wait for each turn to end.

I play around half hour on the allied side. The gameplay is pretty brutal: the germans are overwhelming, and fast to attack, many of my units get eliminated even without a chance to replay. 

This time I am trying to build a defensive line and carefully counter attack, but it does not seem to be a good tactic. Maybe next time I will try gather my forces at the second river and start the counterattack when the german's try to cross. This would hopefully minimize my losses.
